definition[0]: an official letter from a bank allowing a particular person to take money from another bank
definition[1]: in foreign trade, a written promise by an importer’s bank to pay the exporter’s bank on a particular date or at a particular time after the goods are sent by the exporter
example[0]: Coffee buyers in Central America are required to have proof of financing, such as a letter of credit.
definition[2]: when bonds are sold, a written promise by a bank that it will repay the bonds to lenders if the borrower is unable to repay them
example[1]: The notes are backed by a letter of credit from Morgan Guaranty Trust Co.
